Author: Nick Bk (YAF.fy)#1402
Content:
could someone clarify what is the difference between agama wallet, barterdex and hyperdex, is it same entities or not?
ask because I could see balance in Agama, but not in hyperdex

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
@Nick Bk (YAF.fy) Make sure you are using same seed on hyperdex, because all products share same code base for resolving address.
Can you check address generated on both agama lite and hyperdex is same ?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: Even with differing code-bases, the x encryption of y always returns the same z; or else none of what we do would work

Author: Nick Bk (YAF.fy)#1402
Content:
my fault, seems ok
but can I use exodus multi wallet seed in hyperdex?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉 not sure what TZ you are in, but you will want a stiff drink, and maybe bum a "cigarrette" from Elon Musk

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉 you can see a centos builder in the Zcash ci system here: http://ci.z.cash/#/builders

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in general, Zcash source code does not build on CentOS without sacrificing a part of yourself

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: for some fun issues from 2 years ago, you can read this: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/1053

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: latest libsnark is completely crazy and new, with rust stuff, not sure if that stuff is packaged well on centos/etc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: RavenCoin has implemented the worst 51% attack prevention to date, and said KMD was incompatible with their "decentralized nature", so I couldn't resist: https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1054002122583269376

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the "protection" is that the 51% attacker cant get 56 blocks ahead?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 60 confirmations is their 51% attack prevention

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: because a miner has never shown a re-org that big 游땿
